arts.ttl: Tottenham's best and worst players from Europa League defeat against Galatasaray
arts.sum: Assessing Tottenham's best and worst players in the Europa League defeat to Galatasaray.

arts.ttl: Why 'humble' Osimhen is thriving at Galatasaray
arts.sum: Galatasaray assistant manager Ismael Garcia Gomez admits even they were taken by surprise when the opportunity arose to sign Victor Osimhen on loan from Napoli.

arts.ttl: Galatasaray boss is ‘just laughing’ at Jose Mourinho’s Turkish football outburst
arts.sum: Okan Buruk defended Galatasaray after a five-goal thriller with Tottenham.

arts.ttl: Tottenham Hotspur eyeing up 2025 move for La Liga defender
arts.sum: Rayo Vallecano are likely preparing to lose right-back Andrei Ratiu next summer, as interest grows in the Romanian international. Valencia are reported to be keeping tabs on him, and now, interest has arrived from the Premier League. As reported by CaughtOffside, Tottenham Hotspur have registered their interest in Ratiu, as they make preparations for a […] The post Tottenham Hotspur eyeing up 2025 move for La Liga defender appeared first on Football España.
Ange was asked, 'why did you struggle to control the game in the first half? The red card, it was a bit of over-enthusiasm in that moment to give away a foul, but he'll learn from that.

Speaking to us straight after the game, Ange reflected: “I’m disappointed with the first half - we were nowhere near the levels we should be, especially with the ball, really wasteful. “That was disappointing… second half, going down to 10 men, it was always going to make things challenging, but I always felt we’d finish stronger, and I thought we did, the 10 guys out there, we probably played our best football down to 10 men, scored a good goal, couple of other chances, and we could have got something out of the game.”

arts.ttl: Lloris: How I realised Tottenham will always be Spursy
arts.sum: Former Tottenham captain Hugo Lloris has revealed the moment he questioned whether the club ‘really want to win’ after being shocked by a gesture from chairman Daniel Levy. Tottenham’s faced off against Liverpool in the 2019 Champions League final and Lloris has revealed that Levy bought watches for the entire squad prior to the match, which Spurs went on to lose after conceding an early penalty.

arts.ttl: Postecoglou press conference LIVE - Spurs boss on Lankshear and Galatasaray loss
arts.sum: Spurs were in Turkey in a hostile atmosphere at RAMS Park in Istanbul against a Galatasaray side which included on-loan Napoli striker Victor Osimhen and former Tottenham man Davinson Sanchez . Spurs levelled when 18-year-old Archie Gray picked out Brennan Johnson's run with a great pass and he cushioned the ball across to 19-year-old Will Lankshear to smash home his first goal for the club on 18 minutes.

arts.ttl: He’ll learn – Ange Postecoglou backs Will Lankshear to recover from red card
arts.sum: Lankshear received two bookings in seven second-half minutes to earn a red card on his second Spurs start.

arts.ttl: Ange Postecoglou pinpoints Tottenham's big flaw after Galatasaray stinker
arts.sum: GALATASARAY 3-2 TOTTENHAM: Victor Osimhen scored twice as Spurs' second-string defence produced a comedy of errors to taste first Europa League defeat of the season
